resources.name: The NCWorks Career Center
resources.description: Career centers and online resources for finding work. The site has a comprehensive list of the Career Centers in each county.

resources.name: Former Offender Initiative
resources.description: North Carolina Department of Commerce initiative to help job seekers who have criminal records overcome barriers to employment

resources.name: Goodwill Industries International
resources.description: Goodwill Industries provides training and job services. You can search for a Goodwill in your area by checking the Job & Career Support box at the top of the page under the main menu and entering your city or town in the search box.

resources.name: Lionheart.org
resources.description: Lionheart offers emotional literacy programs that can help better the lives of individuals and families.

resources.name: Bonds4jobs.com
resources.description: Bonds4jobs.com is a free government service "safety net" giving employers access to job seekers who may be at a hiring disadvantage.

resources.name: NC Peer Support Specialist Program
resources.description: This program brings people living in recovery who have a mental illness or substance abuse disorder to provide support to others who can benefit from their lived experiences. They are certified by the State to provide support to others with mental health or substance use disorders.

resources.name: NC Vocational Rehabilitation Services
resources.description: Vocational Rehabilitation Services provides employment assistance to those with a qualifying mental or physical disability.
